sn56.55:1.1: “Mendicants, suppose a person was to place seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds on the great earth.
sn56.55:1.3: Which is more: the seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds, or the great earth?”
sn56.55:1.4: “Sir, the great earth is certainly more. The seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds are tiny.
sn56.55:1.5: Compared to the great earth, they can’t be reckoned or compared, they’re not even a fraction.”
sn56.55:1.6: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.55:1.7: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
